name: WDC_DST

attributes.DESCRIPTION: UTC timestamp - middle of the interval for which the Dst values are given
Absolute rate of change of the hourly Dst index (calculated as an absolute value of the difference between two consecutive hourly Dst values)
Version of the sample as a number of applied corrections
Dst status flag: 0 - definitive value, 1 - provisional value, 2 - real-time value

name: SW_EFIxTIE_2_
description: Swarm Thermal Ion Imager (TII) ion temperatures estimate

attributes.DESCRIPTION: Ion temperature estimated using Swarm TII drift at high latitudes
Ion temperature estimated using Weimer 2005 model drifts at high latitude

Flags characterising TII-based Ti: Bit0 = 1/0: high-latitude frictional heating included/omitted, Bit1=1/0: electron temperature from low/high-gain probe, Bit2=1/0: ion temperature data available/data value is set to NaN

Flags characterising model-based Ti: Bit0 = 1/0: high-latitude frictional heating included/omitted, Bit1=1/0: electron temperature from low/high-gain probe, Bit2=1/0: ion temperature data available/data value is set to NaN

name: SW_EFIx_TCTyy
description: Swarm Thermal Ion Imager (TII) cross track flow at 2Hz and 16Hz
dataTerms: This dataset is provided by the European Space Agency and it is subject to terms condition described in https://vires.services/data_terms.

attributes.DESCRIPTION: Along-track ion drift from horizontal TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates.
Random error estimate for along-track ion drift from horizontal TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates. Negative value indicates no estimate available.
Along-track ion drift from vertical TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates.
Random error estimate for along-track ion drift from vertical TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates. Negative value indicates no estimate available.
Cross-track horizontal ion drift from horizontal TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates.
Random error estimate for cross-track horizontal ion drift from horizontal TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates. Negative value indicates no estimate available.
Cross-track vertical ion drift from vertical TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates.
Random error estimate for cross-track vertical ion drift from vertical TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates. Negative value indicates no estimate available.
Satellite velocity N component in north-east-centre coordinates.
Satellite velocity E component in north-east-centre coordinates.
Satellite velocity C component in north-east-centre coordinates.
Electric field x component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from -VxB with along-track ion drift from horizontal sensor.
Electric field y component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from -VxB with along-track ion drift from horizontal sensor.
Electric field z component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from -VxB with along-track ion drift from horizontal sensor.
Electric field x component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from -VxB with along-track ion drift from vertical sensor.
Electric field y component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from -VxB with along-track ion drift from vertical sensor.
Electric field z component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from -VxB with along-track ion drift from vertical sensor.
Geomagnetic field x component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from the 1 Hz product.
Geomagnetic field y component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from the 1 Hz product.
Geomagnetic field z component in satellite-track coordinates, derived from the 1 Hz product.
Ion drift corotation signal x component in satellite-track coordinates. This has been removed from ion drift and electric field.
Ion drift corotation signal y component in satellite-track coordinates. This has been removed from ion drift and electric field.
Ion drift corotation signal z component in satellite-track coordinates. This has been removed from ion drift and electric field.

Bitwise flag for each velocity component, where a value of 1 for a particular component signifies that calibration was successful, and that the baseline 1-sigma noise level is less than or equal to 100 m/s at 2 Hz. Electric field quality can be assessed from these flags according to -vxB. Bit0 (least significant) = Vixh, bit1 = Vixv, bit2 = Viy, bit3 = Viz. Refer to the release notes for details.
Information about the calibration process. Refer to the release notes for details.

name: SW_IPDxIRR_2F
description: Swarm characteristics of the plasma density and plasma irregularities
dataTerms: This dataset is provided by the European Space Agency and it is subject to terms condition described in https://vires.services/data_terms.

attributes.DESCRIPTION: Plasma density, directly copied from the Langmuir probe files.
Background density, as calculated from Ne using a percentile filter of 551 datapoints (2 Hz raw data) and 35 as the percentile.
Foreground density, as calculated from ndens using a percentile filter of 7 datapoints (2 Hz raw data) and 50 as the percentile.
Electron temperature, directly copied from the Langmuir probe files.

The polar cap patch flag:  0 if the plasma density measurement occurred OUTSIDE a polar cap patch. 1 if the plasma density measurement occurred at one of the edges of a polar cap patch (no plasma velocity measurements are available). 2 if the plasma density measurement occurred at the LEADING edge of a polar cap patch. 3 if the plasma density measurement occurred at the TRAILING edge of a polar cap patch. 4 if the plasma density measurement occurred INSIDE a polar cap patch proper. When no ion drift data is available, the leading and trailing edges cannot be distinguished. In this case the polar cap patch flag is set to 4 throughout the patch proper and to 1 throughout both edges.
The electron density gradient in a running window calculated via linear regression over 27 data points for the 2 Hz electron density data.
The electron density gradient in a running window calculated via linear regression over 13 data points for the 2 Hz electron density data.
The electron density gradient in a running window calculated via linear regression over 5 data points for the 2 Hz electron density data.
The linear electron density gradient calculated over the edges of a patch. This variable is non-zero only at the edges of polar cap patches.
Rate Of change of Density Index (RODI) is the standard deviation of ROD over 10 seconds.
Rate Of change of Density Index (RODI) is the standard deviation of ROD over 20 seconds.
Derived by subtracting Ne by its median filtered value in 10 seconds. As a result, delta_Ne10s indicates the electron density fluctuations smaller than 75 km.
Derived by subtracting Ne by its median filtered value in 20 seconds. As a result, delta_Ne20s indicates the electron density fluctuations smaller than 150 km.
Derived by subtracting Ne by its median filtered value in 40 seconds. As a result, delta_Ne40s indicates the electron density fluctuations smaller than 300 km.
Total number of tracked GPS satellites above 20 degrees.
Median of VTEC from all available GPS satellites above 30 degrees.
Median of Rate Of change of TEC (ROT) from all available GPS satellites above 30 degrees.
Median of Rate Of change of TEC Index (ROTI) from all available GPS satellites above 30 degrees. The ROTI of each satellite is the standard deviation of ROT over 10 seconds.
Median of Rate Of change of TEC Index (ROTI) from all available GPS satellites above 30 degrees. The ROTI of each satellite is the standard deviation of ROT over 20 seconds.
Plasma Bubble Index, copied from the level-2 Ionospheric Bubble Index product, IBIxTMS_2F.
0: equator, 1: mid-latitudes; 2: auroral oval; 3: polar cap.
The numeric index for plasma fluctuations and irregularities: 0-3 low, 4-5 medium, and > 6 high level of ionosphericplasma irregularities.
Quality flag for the Ne data and the derived data from Ne, e.g., background density, foreground density etc.
STD of VTEC from all GPS satellites.
F10.7 - Daily 10.7 cm solar radio flux, units: 10**(-22) Joules/second/square-meter/Hertz, from NGDC (1963/001-2016/366)

name: CH_ME_MAG_LR_3
description: CHAMP vector (FGM) magnetic field measurements.
dataTerms: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0)

attributes.DESCRIPTION: scalar B-field in FGM-1 sensor system
status informations for positions; column 1 - number of gaps in interpolation interval; column 2 - flag for PDO used instead of RSO; column 3 - number of basePoints used for interpolation

FGM Quality information; ### bits of byte 1 (8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1) ### 1 - adc (first sample anormal (1) or not (0)), ### 3,2 sample frequency, ### (00 - sample freq is  50 Hz, ### 01 - sample freq is  10 Hz, ### 10 - sample freq is   1 Hz, ### 11 - sample freq is  illegal), ### 4 - torquer overlap flag (ok (0), no torquer overlap (1)), ### 5 - redundant flag, ### 6 - bad average distribution (ok (0), bad (1)), ### 7 - ovm frequenzy correction flag (), ### 8 - ovm not hk overlaped flag (ok (0), no overlap (1)), ### bits of byte 2 (8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1) ### 1 - L3 ovm interpolated flag (no (0), interpolated (1)), ### 2 - L3 fgm interpolated flag (no (0), interpolated (1)), ### 3 - L3 delta interpolated flag (no (0), interpolated (1)), ### 4 - L3 value not corrected (ok (0), no correction (1)), ### 5 - empty, ### 6 - FGM Burst mode (compression on (1), off (0)), ### 7 - L2 ovm gps error corrected (no (0), corrected (1)), ### 8 - L2 fgm gps error corrected (no (0), corrected (1))

star camera quality information 1st digit mode = 0: no data, ### 1st digit mode = 1: not available, ### 1st digit mode = 2: single data boom, chu2cr static, ### 1st digit mode = 3: not available, ### 1st digit mode = 4: not available, ### 1st digit mode = 5: not available, ### 1st digit mode = 6: single data boom + chu2cr dynamic, ### 1st digit mode = 7: dual data boom, ### 2nd digit filtered (0: no, 1: yes), ### 3rd digit chu2cr (0: static, 1: dynamic, 2: dual), ### 4th digit jump correction (0: no, 1: chu1/3, 2: chu2/4, 3: chu1/3 and chu2/4), ### 5th digit gaps interpolated (0: no, 1: chu1/3, 2: chu2/4, 3: chu1/3 and chu2/4)
star camera mode (from left to right): 1st A1 Camera 1 Boom; 2nd A2 Camera 2 Boom; 3rd B1 Camera 1 Body; 4rd B2 Camera 2 Body
ASC quaternions for ICRF -> CRF transformation
